thread.title: Intelligence Chief to Trump: We Didn't Leak Russia Memo
thread.title_full: Intelligence Chief to Trump: We Didn't Leak Russia Memo

author: Phil Helsel
title: Intelligence Chief to Trump: We Didn't Leak Russia Memo
text:
Firestorm After Release of Unverified Allegations About Pres.-elect Trump 3:23  embed/852880963675"   
Director of National Intelligence James Clapper said he spoke with President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday and told him the intelligence community did not leak information about an unverified memo that sparked a firestorm of controversy when it was published online. 
"I emphasized that this document is not a U.S. Intelligence Community product and that I do not believe the leaks came from within the IC," Clapper said, referring to the intelligence community. "The IC has not made any judgment that the information in this document is reliable, and we did not rely upon it in any way for our conclusions." 
Related: Donald Trump Wasn't Told About Unverified Russia Memo, Official Says 
The 35-page privately-prepared memorandum published by BuzzFeed on Tuesday includes claims that the Russian government has been cultivating, supporting and assisting Trump for five years, among other allegations. (BuzzFeed   
Trump called the claims a "complete fabrication" and called BuzzFeed "a failing pile of garbage" during a previously-scheduled press conference Wednesday. 
Clapper said in the statement that he spoke with Trump about "recent media reports about our briefing last Friday." 
"I expressed my profound dismay at the leaks that have been appearing in the press, and we both agreed that they are extremely corrosive and damaging to our national security," Clapper said. 
Related: Former British Spy Prepared Explosive Trump Memo 
Trump was not told about unverified memo during last week's intelligence briefing,   told NBC news. A   details in the memo was prepared as background, but was   meeting, the official said. Play
